clinical_study.brief_title: Autologous Transplantation of BM-ECs With Platelet-Rich Plasma Extract for the Treatment of Critical Limb Ischemia

lead_sponsor.agency: South China Research Center for Stem Cell and Regenerative Medicine

clinical_study.source: South China Research Center for Stem Cell and Regenerative Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The intent of this clinical study is to evaluate the safety of the injection composed of autologous bone marrow derived endothelial cells (BM-ECs) and platelet-rich plasma extract (PRPE) for the treatment of critical limb ischemia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perfusion rate in treated tissue by measure of ankle-brachial index (ABI)
Perfusion rate in treated tissue by transcutaneous PO2 (TcPO2)
Perfusion rate in treated tissue by digital subtraction angiography (DSA)

secondary_outcome.description: Pain intensity using Visual Analogue Scale

arm_group.description: Multipoint of intramuscular injections into ischemic limbs.Injections composed of bone marrow derived endothelial cells (BM-ECs) and platelet-rich plasma extract (PRPE).
Intramuscular injection of bone marrow derived endothelial cells only.
